
                                    TP04310
________________________________________________________________________________

  Introduction:

  This instrument driver provides programming support for TP04310.
  It contains functions for opening, configuring, taking measurements from, and
  closing the instrument.

________________________________________________________________________________

  Assumptions:

  To successfully use this module, the following conditions must be met:

  For GPIB instrument drivers:
         -  the instrument is connected to the GPIB.
         -  the GPIB address supplied to the initialize function must match the
            GPIB address of the instrument.

  For VXI instrument drivers:
         -  the instrument is installed in the VXI mainframe and you are
            using one of the following controller options:
                  Embedded controller
                  MXI
                  MXI2
                  GPIB-VXI
         -  the logical address supplied to the initialize function must
            match the logical address of the instrument.

  For RS-232 instrument drivers:
         -  the instrument is connected to the RS-232 interface.
         -  the COM port, baud rate, parity, and timeout supplied to the
            initialize function must match the settings of the instrument.

________________________________________________________________________________

  Error and Status Information:

  Each function in this instrument driver returns a status code that
  either indicates success or describes an error or warning condition.
  Your program should examine the status code from each call to an
  instrument driver function to determine if an error occurred.
  The general meaning of the status code is as follows:

       Value                  Meaning
       -------------------------------
       0                      Success
       Positive Values        Warnings
       Negative Values        Errors

  The description of each instrument driver function lists possible error
  codes and their meanings

________________________________________________________________________________

  How To Use This Document:

  Use this document as a programming reference manual.
  It describes each function in the

                                    TP04310

  instrument.  The functions appear in alphabetical order, with a description
  of the function and its C syntax, a description of each parameter, and a list
  of possible error codes.

________________________________________________________________________________

Function Tree Layout:

   Class/Panel Name:                      Function Name:

      Initialize                          TP04310_init
      Configuration Functions
         Write Configuration Parameter    TP04310_write_config_parameter
         Read Configuration Parameter     TP04310_read_config_parameter
         Setpoint Configuration
            Write Setpoint Info           TP04310_write_setpoint_info
            Read Setpoint Info            TP04310_read_setpoint_info
            Write Setpoint Number         TP04310_write_setpoint_number
            Read Setpoint Number          TP04310_read_setpoint_number
            Write Setpoint Temperature    TP04310_write_setpoint_temperature
            Read Setpoint Temperature     TP04310_read_setpoint_temperature
            Write Setpoint Window         TP04310_write_setpoint_window
            Read Setpoint Window          TP04310_read_setpoint_window
            Write Setpoint Soak Time      TP04310_write_setpoint_soak
            Read Setpoint Soak Time       TP04310_read_setpoint_soak
            Write Setpoint Ramp Rate      TP04310_write_setpoint_ramp
            Read Setpoint Ramp Rate       TP04310_read_setpoint_ramp
         Setup File Configuration
            Load Setup File               TP04310_load_setup_file
            Save Current Setup File       TP04310_save_setup
         Service Request Configuration
            Read SRE Register             TP04310_read_SRE
            Write SRE Register            TP04310_write_SRE
            Read TESE Register            TP04310_read_TESE
            Write TESE Register           TP04310_write_TESE
            Read ESE Register             TP04310_read_ESE
            Write ESE Register            TP04310_write_ESE
      Action/Status Functions
         Action Functions
            Start Stop Cycling            TP04310_cycle
            Query Cycling Status          TP04310_cycle_query
            Run to Next Setpoint          TP04310_next_setpoint
         Status Functions
            Get Status Byte               TP04310_read_STB
            Get ESR                       TP04310_read_ESR
            Get TESR                      TP04310_read_TESR
            Get TECR                      TP04310_read_TECR
            Get AUXC register             TP04310_read_AUXC
      Data Functions
         Get Air Flow Data in scfm        TP04310_read_air_flow_scfm
         Get Air Flow Data in l/s         TP04310_read_air_flow_lites_per_sec
         Get Dynamic Temp Setpoint        TP04310_read_dynamic_setpoint
         Get Main Control Temperature     TP04310_read_control_temperature
         Get Air Nozzle Temperature       TP04310_read_air_temperature
         Get DUT Temperature              TP04310_read_DUT_temperature
      Utility Functions
         Write To Instrument              TP04310_writeInstrData
         Read Instrument Data             TP04310_readInstrData
         Reset                            TP04310_reset
         Reset in Op Screen               TP04310_reset_op_screen
         Device Clear                     TP04310_device_clear
         Device Error Clear               TP04310_device_error_clear
         Self-Test                        TP04310_selfTest
         Error-Query                      TP04310_errorQuery
         Error Message                    TP04310_errorMessage
         Revision Query                   TP04310_revisionQuery
         Device Specific
            Write Device Command          TP04310_write_device_command
            Read Device State             TP04310_read_device_state
      Close                               TP04310_close
________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310

      This instrument module provides programming support for the <Instrument
      Name>.  The module is divided into the following functions:

      Functions/Classes:

      (1) Initialize:
      This function initializes the instrument and sets it to a default
      configuration.

      (2) Application Functions: (Class)
      This class contains high-level, test and measurement routines.  These
      examples call other instrument driver functions to configure, start, and
      read from the instrument.

      (3) Configuration Functions: (Class)
      This class of functions configures the instrument by setting acquisition
      and system configuration parameters.

      (4) Action/Status Functions: (Class)
      This class of functions begins or terminates an acquisition. It also
      provides functions which allow the user to determine the current status
      of the instrument.

      (5) Data Functions: (Class)
      This class of functions transfers data to or from the instrument.

      (6) Utility Functions: (Class)
      This class of functions provides lower level functions to communicate
      with the instrument, and change instrument parameters.

      (7) Close:
      This function takes the instrument offline.

________________________________________________________________________________

              The following functions are in alphabetical order.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_close

      ViStatus TP04310_close (ViSession instrumentHandle);

  Purpose

      This function performs the following operations:
      viClose (instrSession) and viClose (rmSession).

      Notes:

      (1) The instrument must be reinitialized to use it again.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_cycle

      ViStatus TP04310_cycle (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                              ViInt16 startStopCycling);

  Purpose

      This function allows to start and stop cycling.

      Note: When all cycles have been completed or when cycling was stopped on
      failure, it is necessary to send cycle stop command to reset the system.


      [Start Stop Cycling] control:

      Valid Range: 0 - 1

      0 - stop cycling
      1 - start cycling



  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      startStopCycling

          Variable Type       ViInt16

          This control allows to start and stop cycling.

          Note: When all cycles have been completed or when cycling was stopped
          on failure, it is necessary to send cycle stop command to reset the
          system.

          Valid Range: 0 - 1

          0 - stop cycling
          1 - start cycling





  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_cycle_query

      ViStatus TP04310_cycle_query (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                    ViPInt16 cyclingStatus);

  Purpose

      This function reads the current cycle number if cycling, last value if
      not.

      Valid Range: 0 - 9999

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      cyclingStatus

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the current cycle number if cycling, last value
          if not.

          Valid Range: 0 - 9999

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_device_clear

      ViStatus TP04310_device_clear (ViSession instrumentHandle);

  Purpose

      This function clears the standard event status and temperature event
      status registers.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_device_error_clear

      ViStatus TP04310_device_error_clear (ViSession instrumentHandle);

  Purpose

      This function clears device-specific errors.


  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_errorMessage

      ViStatus TP04310_errorMessage (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                     ViStatus statusCode,
                                     ViChar _VI_FAR message[]);

  Purpose

      This function takes the Status Code returned by the instrument driver
      functions, interprets it and returns it as a user readable string.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  VI_NULL

      statusCode

          Variable Type       ViStatus

          This control accepts the Status Code returned from the instrument
          driver functions.

          Default Value:
          0 - VI_SUCCESS

      message

          Variable Type       ViChar[]

          This control returns the interpreted Status Code as a user readable
          message string.

          Notes:

          (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256].

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          3FFF0085  VI_WARN_UNKNOWN_STATUS

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_errorQuery

      ViStatus TP04310_errorQuery (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                   ViPInt32 errorCode,
                                   ViChar _VI_FAR errorMessage[]);

  Purpose

      This function reads a device-specific error code from the instrument's
      error queue.



  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      errorCode

          Variable Type       ViInt32 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the error code read from the instrument's error
          queue.


      errorMessage

          Variable Type       ViChar[]

          This control returns the error message string read from the
          instrument's error message queue.

          Notes:

          (1) The array must contain at least 256 elements ViChar[256].

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0104  Error Query not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_ERROR_QUERY
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_init

      ViStatus TP04310_init (ViRsrc resourceName, ViBoolean IDQuery,
                             ViBoolean resetDevice, ViInt32 baudRate,
                             ViInt16 parity, ViInt32 timeout,
                             ViPSession instrumentHandle);

  Purpose

      This function performs the following initialization actions:

      - Opens a session to the Default Resource Manager resource and a session
      to the specified device using the interface and address specified in the
      Resource_Name control.

      - Performs an identification query on the Instrument.

      - Resets the instrument to a known state.

      - Sends initialization commands to the instrument that set any necessary
      programmatic variables such as Headers Off, Short Command form, and Data
      Transfer Binary to the state necessary for the operation of the
      instrument driver.

      - Returns an Instrument Handle which is used to differentiate between
      different sessions of this instrument driver.

      - Each time this function is invoked a Unique Session is opened.  It is
      possible to have more than one session open for the same resource.



  Parameter List

      resourceName

          Variable Type       ViRsrc

          This control specifies the interface and address of the device that
          is to be initialized (Instrument Descriptor). The exact grammar to be
          used in this control is shown in the note below.

          Default Value:  "GPIB::1"

          Notes:

          (1) Based on the Instrument Descriptor, this operation establishes a
          communication session with a device.  The grammar for the Instrument
          Descriptor is shown below.  Optional parameters are shown in square
          brackets ([]).

          Interface   Grammar
          ------------------------------------------------------
          GPIB        GPIB[board]::primary address[::secondary address]
                      [::INSTR]

          The GPIB keyword is used with GPIB instruments.

          The default value for optional parameters are shown below.

          Optional Parameter          Default Value
          -----------------------------------------
          board                       0
          secondary address           none - 31


      IDQuery

          Variable Type       ViBoolean

          This control specifies if an ID Query is sent to the instrument
          during the initialization procedure.

          Valid Range:
          VI_OFF (0) - Skip Query
          VI_ON  (1) - Do Query (Default Value)

          Notes:

          (1) Under normal circumstances the ID Query ensures that the
          instrument initialized is the type supported by this driver. However
          circumstances may arise where it is undesirable to send an ID Query
          to the instrument.  In those cases; set this control to "Skip Query"
          and this function will initialize the selected interface, without
          doing an ID Query.

          /**** DELETE THIS NOTE AND THE STATUS CODE IF SUPPORTED *****/
          (2) If this instrument does not support an ID Query, and this control
          is set to "Do Query" then this function should return the Warning
          Code 0x3FFC0101 - VI_WARN_NSUP_ID_QUERY.


      resetDevice

          Variable Type       ViBoolean

          This control specifies if the instrument is to be reset to its
          power-on settings during the initialization procedure.

          Valid Range:
          VI_OFF (0) - Don't Reset
          VI_ON  (1) - Reset Device (Default Value)

          Notes:

          (1) If you do not want the instrument reset. Set this control to
          "Don't Reset" while initializing the instrument.

          /**** DELETE THIS NOTE AND THE STATUS CODE IF SUPPORTED *****/
          (2) If this instrument does not support a Reset, and this control is
          set to "Reset Device" then this function should return the Warning
          Code 0x3FFC0102 - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET.


      baudRate

          Variable Type       ViInt32

      parity

          Variable Type       ViInt16

      timeout

          Variable Type       ViInt32

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession (passed by reference)

          This control returns an Instrument Handle that is used in all
          subsequent function calls to differentiate between different sessions
          of this instrument driver.

          Notes:

          (1) Each time this function is invoked a Unique Session is opened.
          It is possible to have more than one session open for the same
          resource.


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0101  ID Query not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_ID_QUERY
          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFC0103  Self Test not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_SELF_TEST
          3FFC0104  Error Query not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_ERROR_QUERY
          3FFC0105  Revision Query not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_REV_QUERY
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFC0001  Parameter 1 out of range. (String not range checked)
          BFFC0002  Parameter 2 (ID Query) out of range.
          BFFC0003  Parameter 3 (Reset Device) out of range.
          BFFC0004  Parameter 4 out of range.
          BFFC0005  Parameter 5 out of range.
          BFFC0006  Parameter 6 out of range.
          BFFC0007  Parameter 7 out of range.
          BFFC0008  Parameter 8 out of range.
          BFFC0011  Instrument returned invalid response to ID Query

          BFFC0800  Error Opening File      VI_ERROR_INSTR_FILE_OPEN
          BFFC0801  Error Writing to File   VI_ERROR_INSTR_FILE_WRITE
          BFFC0803  Invalid Response VI_ERROR_INSTR_INTERPRETING_RESPONSE
          BFFC0809  Parameter 9 out of range.  VI_ERROR_INSTR_PARAMETER9
          BFFC080A  Parameter 10 out of range. VI_ERROR_INSTR_PARAMETER10
          BFFC080B  Parameter 11 out of range. VI_ERROR_INSTR_PARAMETER11
          BFFC080C  Parameter 12 out of range. VI_ERROR_INSTR_PARAMETER12

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

          Notes:

          (1) Parameter Error Codes for parameters 1 through 8 are defined in
          the vpptype.h header file the range is BFFC0001 - BFFC0008; Parameter
          Error Codes for parameters 9 through 15 are defined in the instrument
          driver's header file the range is BFFC0809 - BFFC080F; for parameter
          errors greater than 15, and other instrument specific error codes,
          use an error code in the range of BFFC0900 to BFFC0FFF.  This is
          equivalent to using (VI_ERROR_INSTR_OFFSET + n); where n represents
          each instrument specific error number.  Valid ranges for n are 0 to
          6FF.  (All values are given in Hexadecimal Notation)

          (2) Delete all unused status codes from the Status Control of each
          function panel when you are finished development of your instrument
          driver, for example in this control the status codes for parameters
          1, 3-8, and the codes for Error Opening and Writing to File should be
          deleted.  Those status codes are provided here as a convenience for
          during driver development.

          (3) Delete these three (3) notes when you are finished with your
          driver development.
________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_load_setup_file

      ViStatus TP04310_load_setup_file (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                        ViInt16 setupFile);

  Purpose

      This function sends a command to the instrument to load the setup file 1
      to 12 specifed by Setup File control.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setupFile

          Variable Type       ViInt16

          This control specifies the setup file to be loaded. Different  setups
          file are numbered 1 to 12.


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_next_setpoint

      ViStatus TP04310_next_setpoint (ViSession instrumentHandle);

  Purpose

      This function sends a command to the instrument to step to the next
      setpoint during temperature cycling.
      The function will generate a command error if the instrument is not
      cycling.

      Note: Stepping will occure whether or not the device is at temperature.



  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_air_flow_lites_per_sec

      ViStatus TP04310_read_air_flow_lites_per_sec (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                                    ViPReal64 currentAirFlow_literssecond);

  Purpose

      This function reads the current air flow in liters per second.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      currentAirFlow_literssecond

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the current air flow in liters per second.

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_air_flow_scfm

      ViStatus TP04310_read_air_flow_scfm (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                           ViPReal64 currentAirFlow_scfm);

  Purpose

      This function reads the current air flow in scfm.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      currentAirFlow_scfm

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the current air flow in scfm.

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_air_temperature

      ViStatus TP04310_read_air_temperature (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                             ViPReal64 airTemperature);

  Purpose

      This function reads the air temperature in Celsius.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      airTemperature

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the air temperature in Celsius.



  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_AUXC

      ViStatus TP04310_read_AUXC (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                  ViPInt16 auxiliaryRegister);

  Purpose

      This function reads the auxiliary condition register (AUXC).

      This control returns the auxiliary condition register (AUXC).

      Valid range: 0 - 65535

      bit 0 - reserved
      bit 1 - reserved
      bit 2 - head up = 0; head down = 1
      bit 3 - compressor on = 0; heat only mode = 1
      bit 4 - air mode = 0; DUT mode = 1
      bit 5 - flow off = 0; flow on = 1
      bit 6 - start up sequence = 0; ready for operation = 1
      bit 7 - reserved
      bit 8 - program mode = 0; manual mode = 1
      bit 9 - ramp mode
      bit 10 - reserved
      bit 11 - not used
      bit 12 - not used
      bit 13 - not used
      bit 14 - not used
      bit 15 - not used

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      auxiliaryRegister

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the auxiliary condition register (AUXC).

          Valid range: 0 - 65535

          bit 0 - reserved
          bit 1 - reserved
          bit 2 - head up = 0; head down = 1
          bit 3 - compressor on = 0; heat only mode = 1
          bit 4 - air mode = 0; DUT mode = 1
          bit 5 - flow off = 0; flow on = 1
          bit 6 - start up sequence = 0; ready for operation = 1
          bit 7 - reserved
          bit 8 - program mode = 0; manual mode = 1
          bit 9 - ramp mode
          bit 10 - reserved
          bit 11 - not used
          bit 12 - not used
          bit 13 - not used
          bit 14 - not used
          bit 15 - not used

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_config_parameter

      ViStatus TP04310_read_config_parameter (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                              ViInt16 configurationParameterID,
                                              ViPInt16 configurationParameterValue);

  Purpose

      This function writes a configuration parameter to the TP04300 instrument.

      The following Configuration Parameter IDs are allowed:

      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_NONE] - a default parameter configures
                                    nothing
      /*============================================================*/

      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_CYCLE_COUNT] - used to configure the number of
      cycles

      Configuration Parameter Value: his control accepts the cycle count to set
      the desired number of cycles to run.

      Default Value:  1

      Valid Range: 1-9999

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_SHUTDOWN_TIMER] - used to configure the shutdown
      timer. Set to 0 to disable shutdown timer.

      Default Value:  0

      Valid Range: 0-1000

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_TEST_TIME] - used to configure the test time.

      Default Value:  0

      Valid Range: 0-9999

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_SENSOR_TYPE] - used to configure the DUT sensor
      type.

      0 - no DUT sensor is selected, air mode
      1 - T-Type thermocouple, DUT mode
      0 - K-Type thermocouple, DUT mode

      Default Value:  0

      Valid Range: 0-2

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_THERMAL_CONSTANT] - used to configure the DUT
      thermal constant parameter.

      Default Value:  100

      Valid Range: 20-500

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_MODE] - used to configure the DUT mode. 0 for
      Air mode; 1 for DUT mode

      Default Value:  0

      Valid Range: 0-1

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_LOW_TEMP_LIMIT] - used to configure the lower
      temperature limit

      Default Value:  -99

      Valid Range: -99 - 25

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_HIGH_TEMP_LIMIT] - used to configure the upper
      temperature limit

      Default Value:  225

      Valid Range: 25 - 225

      /*============================================================*/
      [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_TO_DUT_MAX_DIFFERENCE] - used to configure the
      maximum allowable difference between the air and DUT temperatures.

      Default Value:  300

      Valid Range: 10 - 300

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      configurationParameterID

          Variable Type       ViInt16

          The following Configuration Parameter IDs are allowed:

          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_NONE] - a default parameter configures
                                        nothing
          /*============================================================*/

          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_CYCLE_COUNT] - used to configure the number of
          cycles

          Configuration Parameter Value: his control accepts the cycle count to
          set the desired number of cycles to run.

          Default Value:  1

          Valid Range: 1-9999

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_SHUTDOWN_TIMER] - used to configure the
          shutdown timer. Set to 0 to disable shutdown timer.

          Default Value:  0

          Valid Range: 0-1000

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_TEST_TIME] - used to configure the test time.

          Default Value:  0

          Valid Range: 0-9999

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_SENSOR_TYPE] - used to configure the DUT
          sensor type.

          0 - no DUT sensor is selected, air mode
          1 - T-Type thermocouple, DUT mode
          0 - K-Type thermocouple, DUT mode

          Default Value:  0

          Valid Range: 0-2

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_THERMAL_CONSTANT] - used to configure the
          DUT thermal constant parameter.

          Default Value:  100

          Valid Range: 20-500

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_DUT_MODE] - used to configure the DUT mode. 0
          for Air mode; 1 for DUT mode

          Default Value:  0

          Valid Range: 0-1

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_LOW_TEMP_LIMIT] - used to configure the
          lower temperature limit

          Default Value:  -99

          Valid Range: -99 - 25

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_HIGH_TEMP_LIMIT] - used to configure the
          upper temperature limit

          Default Value:  225

          Valid Range: 25 - 225

          /*============================================================*/
          [TP04310_CONFIG_PARAM_AIR_TO_DUT_MAX_DIFFERENCE] - used to configure
          the maximum allowable difference between the air and DUT
          temperatures.

          Default Value:  300

          Valid Range: 10 - 300

      configurationParameterValue

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_control_temperature

      ViStatus TP04310_read_control_temperature (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                                 ViPReal64 controlTemperature);

  Purpose

      This function reads the main temperature in Celsius.

      Note: The temperature will reflect the air temperature when in
      air-control mode, or DUT temperature whenin DUT-control mode.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      controlTemperature

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the main temperature in Celsius.

          Note: The temperature will reflect the air temperature when in
          air-control mode, or DUT temperature whenin DUT-control mode.

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_device_state

      ViStatus TP04310_read_device_state (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                          ViInt16 instrumentCommand,
                                          ViPInt16 commandArgument);

  Purpose

      This function writes a device specific querry and reads the intrument
      reply, indicating its state.

      The following querries are supported:

      [TP04310_AIR_FLOW] - returns whether the main air flow is On or Off.

           Returns Command Argument = 0  the air flow is off
                                = 1  the air flow is on

      [TP04310_HEAD] - returns whether the head is Up or Down position.

           Returns Command Argument = 0  the head is in Up position
                                = 1  the head Down is in Down position

      [TP04310_COMPRESSOR] - returns whether the compressor is On or Off.

           Returns Command Argument = 0 the compressor is off
                                = 1  the compressor is on


  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      instrumentCommand

          Variable Type       ViInt16

          This control selects the instrument state to be read.

          The following querries are supported:


          [TP04310_AIR_FLOW] - returns whether the main air flow is On or Off.

               Return Command Argument = 0  the air flow is off
                                    = 1  the air flow is on

          [TP04310_HEAD] - returns whether the head is Up or Down position.

               Return Command Argument = 0  the head is in Up position
                                    = 1  the head Down is in Down position

          [TP04310_COMPRESSOR] - returns whether the compressor is On or Off.

               Return Command Argument = 0 the compressor is off
                                    = 1  the compressor is on


      commandArgument

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns an instrument state, as follows below for
          different commands.

          Default Value:  0

          [TP04310_AIR_FLOW] - returns whether the main air flow is On or Off.

               Return Command Argument = 0  the air flow is off
                                    = 1  the air flow is on

          [TP04310_HEAD] - returns whether the head is Up or Down position.

               Return Command Argument = 0  the head is in Up position
                                    = 1  the head Down is in Down position


          [TP04310_COMPRESSOR] - returns whether the compressor is On or Off.

               Return Command Argument = 0 the compressor is off
                                    = 1  the compressor is on



  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_DUT_temperature

      ViStatus TP04310_read_DUT_temperature (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                             ViPReal64 DUTTemperature);

  Purpose

      This function reads the DUT temperature in Celsius.

      Note: The function will return VI_ERROR_INSTR_QUERY_ERROR if the
      instrument is not in the DUT mode.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      DUTTemperature

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the DUT temperature in Celsius.


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_dynamic_setpoint

      ViStatus TP04310_read_dynamic_setpoint (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                              ViPReal64 dynamicSetpoint);

  Purpose

      This function reads the dynamic setpoint in Celsius.

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      dynamicSetpoint

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the dynamic temperature setpoint in Celsius.

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_ESE

      ViStatus TP04310_read_ESE (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                 ViPInt16 ESE_register);

  Purpose

      This function reads the standard event status enable (mask) register
      (ESE).

      Valid range: 0 - 255

      bit 0 - operation complete (not implemented)
      bit 1 - request control (not used)
      bit 2 - query error (QYE)
      bit 3 - device dependent error (DDE)
      bit 4 - execution error (EXE)
      bit 5 - command error (CME)
      bit 6 - user request (not used)
      bit 7 - power on (not used)

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      ESE_register

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the standard event status enable (mask) register
          (ESE).

          Valid range: 0 - 255

          bit 0 - operation complete (not implemented)
          bit 1 - request control (not used)
          bit 2 - query error (QYE)
          bit 3 - device dependent error (DDE)
          bit 4 - execution error (EXE)
          bit 5 - command error (CME)
          bit 6 - user request (not used)
          bit 7 - power on (not used)

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_ESR

      ViStatus TP04310_read_ESR (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                 ViPInt16 ESR_register);

  Purpose

      This function reads the standard event status register (ESR).

      Note: The bits in ESR are latched and are cleared when the register is
      read.

      Valid range: 0 - 255

      bit 0 - operation complete (not implemented)
      bit 1 - request control (not used)
      bit 2 - query error (QYE)
      bit 3 - device dependent error (DDE)
      bit 4 - execution error (EXE)
      bit 5 - command error (CME)
      bit 6 - user request (not used)
      bit 7 - power on (not used)

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      ESR_register

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the standard event status register (ESR).

          Valid range: 0 - 255

          bit 0 - operation complete (not implemented)
          bit 1 - request control (not used)
          bit 2 - query error (QYE)
          bit 3 - device dependent error (DDE)
          bit 4 - execution error (EXE)
          bit 5 - command error (CME)
          bit 6 - user request (not used)
          bit 7 - power on (not used)

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_setpoint_info

      ViStatus TP04310_read_setpoint_info (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                           ViPInt16 setpointNumber,
                                           ViPReal64 setpointTemperature,
                                           ViPReal64 setpointWindow,
                                           ViPInt16 setpointSoakTime,
                                           ViPReal64 setpointRampRate);

  Purpose

      This function allows to querry the setpoint parameters, such as

      [Setpoint Number], for either control or configuration
      Valid range: 0-11 - for the Cycle Screen
                   0-2  - for the Operator Screen

      [Setpoint temperature]
      Valid Range:
                  -99.9 to 225.0 in the Cycle Screen for any setpoint
                   25.0 to 225.0 for setpoint #0 in Operator Screen
                   15.0 to  35.0 for setpoint #1 in Operator Screen
                  -99.9 to  25.0 for setpoint #2 in Operator Screen

      Note: Entering a value greater than maximum air temperature limit or
      less than minimum air temperature limit will cause "out of range error"


      [Setpoint temperature window]
      Valid Range: 0.1 to 9.9

      Note: The window is the maximum positive or negative deviation from
      the temperature setpoint allowable for an "at temperature" condition.

      [Setpoint the soak time]
      Valid Range: 0 to 9999

      [Setpoint ramp rate]
      Valid Range:  0 to 99.9 with 0.1C temperature resolution
              or  100 to 9999 with 1C temperature resolution


  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setpointNumber

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the currently selected setpoint number.

          Valid range: 0-11 - for the Cycle Screen
                       0-2  - for the Operator Screen

      setpointTemperature

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the currently selected setpoint's temperature.

          Valid Range:
                      -99.9 to 225.0 in the Cycle Screen for any setpoint
                       25.0 to 225.0 for setpoint #0 in Operator Screen
                       15.0 to  35.0 for setpoint #1 in Operator Screen
                      -99.9 to  25.0 for setpoint #2 in Operator Screen

          Note: Entering a value greater than maximum air temperature limit
          orless than minimum air temperature limit will cause "out of range
          error"

      setpointWindow

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the currently selected setpoint's temperature
          window.

          Valid Range: 0.1 to 9.9

          Note: The window is the maximum positive or negative deviation from
          the temperature setpoint allowable for an "at temperature" condition.

      setpointSoakTime

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the soak time for the currently selected
          setpoint.

          Valid Range: 0 to 9999


      setpointRampRate

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the ramp rate for the currently selected
          setpoint in Celsius per minute.

          Valid Range:  0 to 99.9 with 0.1C temperature resolution
                  or  100 to 9999 with 1C temperature resolution


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_setpoint_number

      ViStatus TP04310_read_setpoint_number (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                             ViPInt16 setpointNumber);

  Purpose

      This function allows to querry the setpoint number

      Valid range: 0-11 - for the Cycle Screen
                   0-2  - for the Operator Screen


  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setpointNumber

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the currently selected setpoint number.

          Valid range: 0-11 - for the Cycle Screen
                       0-2  - for the Operator Screen

  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_setpoint_ramp

      ViStatus TP04310_read_setpoint_ramp (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                           ViPReal64 setpointRampRate);

  Purpose

      This function allows to querry the setpoint ramp rate.

      Valid Range:  0 to 99.9 with 0.1C temperature resolution
              or  100 to 9999 with 1C temperature resolution


  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setpointRampRate

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the ramp rate for the currently selected
          setpoint in Celsius per minute.

          Valid Range:  0 to 99.9 with 0.1C temperature resolution
                  or  100 to 9999 with 1C temperature resolution


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_setpoint_soak

      ViStatus TP04310_read_setpoint_soak (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                           ViPInt16 setpointSoakTime);

  Purpose

      This function allows to querry the setpoint soak time.

      Valid Range: 0 to 9999

  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setpointSoakTime

          Variable Type       ViInt16 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the soak time for the currently selected
          setpoint.

          Valid Range: 0 to 9999


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
          BFFF0067  Operation is not supported on this session.

________________________________________________________________________________

  TP04310_read_setpoint_temperature

      ViStatus TP04310_read_setpoint_temperature (ViSession instrumentHandle,
                                                  ViPReal64 setpointTemperature);

  Purpose

      This function allows to query the setpoint's temperature.

      Valid Return Range: -150.0 to 225.0



  Parameter List

      instrumentHandle

          Variable Type       ViSession

          This control accepts the Instrument Handle returned by the Initialize
          function to select the desired instrument driver session.

          Default Value:  None

      setpointTemperature

          Variable Type       ViReal64 (passed by reference)

          This control returns the setpoint's temperature.

          Valid Range: -150.0 to 225.0


  Return Value

          This control contains the status code returned by the function call.

          Status Codes:

          Status    Description
          -------------------------------------------------
                 0  No error (the call was successful).

          3FFC0102  Reset not supported - VI_WARN_NSUP_RESET
          3FFF0005  The specified termination character was read.
          3FFF0006  The specified number of bytes was read.

          BFFF0000  Miscellaneous or system error occurred.
          BFFF000E  Invalid session handle.
          BFFF0015  Timeout occurred before operation could complete.
          BFFF0034  Violation of raw write protocol occurred.
          BFFF0035  Violation of raw read protocol occurred.
          BFFF0036  Device reported an output protocol error.
          BFFF0037  Device reported an input protocol error.
          BFFF0038  Bus error occurred during transfer.
          BFFF003A  Invalid setup (attributes are not consistent).
          BFFF005F  No listeners condition was detected.
          BFFF0060  This interface is not the controller in charge.
